page.title: 04The population of Pontycymer
page.content: Before the industrial development of the Valley, the population was sparse. In 1801 the population numbered only 200, scattered about some 25 farms. By 1861 the population had reached 600, and then came the industrial boom. The opening of the mines with increased employment, resulted in a movement of population into the valley and by 1891 it had reached 7000, rising to a peak of 16000 in 1925. This population increase was obviously the result of a great initial influx of immigrant workers and their families chiefly from England and the west country(30%) and from other Welsh counties(56%). Although English is the predominant language, many of the older residents speak Welsh and Welsh chapels stil remain. Welsh is taught at the local comprehensive school and welsh junior school in Bridgend and other places.
